questions.question_text: Which of the following would a company place at the edge of its network if it wants to view and control which Internet applications are being used?
A technician wants to physically connect two office buildings' networks. The office buildings are located 600ft (183m) apart. Which of the following cable types is the BEST choice?

discussion.content: Multimode and Singlemode is a kind of fiber. Multi has multiple lights/lasers being sent, while Single has 1 light/laser that is sent across the cable its benefit is the distance that it can go up to. Fiber while the distance is able to easily surpass copper, Singlemode fiber can go wayyyy longer distances than multimode.

Selected Answer: C
Cat 5E and Cat 6A has a maximum distance of 100M. So Im going with C. Multimode

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are tasked with creating a network that will accomplish the following requirements.
Requirements:
✑ The remote Sales Team must be able to connect to the corporate network.
✑ Each department must have ONLY two PCs and a server.
✑ Each department must be segmented from each other.
✑ The following VLANs have been designed:
- VLAN 2 `" Finance
- VLAN 12 `" Sales
- VLAN 22 `" Human Resources (HR)
✑ Routing for VLAN 12 is implemented on the router. Routing for VLAN 2 and VLAN 22 is on the switch.

INSTRUCTIONS -
Complete the network by dragging the required objects onto the diagram.
Objects can be used multiple times and not all placeholders need to be filled.
If at any time you would like to bring back the initial state of the simulation, please click the Reset All button.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

comments.content:
Yup, it's a hot mess! When in doubt...draw it out! It's also incomplete. Each dept must have two PCs and Server....
Just do your best you can with it.
I thought the exact same thing about your 2nd point. Good to know I wasn't the only one.

discussion.content:
the question stated "Routing for VLAN 12 is implemented on the router. Routing for VLAN 2 and VLAN 22 is on the switch" 
The solution is wrong!!.
1. mislabel of Finance as VLAN 12 instead of VLAN 2
2. "Routing for VLAN 12 is implemented on the router" the sale dept should implement a Layer-2 switch and a router, and while the corporate office should implement both a router and a Layer 3 switch for inter-VLAN. leaving us with a router at each edge of the T1 connections.

You would not terminate the sales VLAN into a server, because the server isn't standalone. You'd use a L2 switch there. Both sides of T1 would use a router. Use a L3 switch to connect the 3 VLANs together.
Okay, but there also should be switches inside of VLANs. Routers are necessary to create connection between VLANs, but you need switches inside of them. I think the answers are wrong

comments.content: Wtf are you on about? There's one switch in the middle of the 3 VLANs on the right side, which is connected to a single router (RoS - Router on a Stick architecture)

You are right, but this diagram is wrong anyway. All the VLAN's on the right side should lead to a L3 switch. That leads into the router, takes the T1 WAN route to another router, which has the Sales VLAN12 go into a L2 switch which then connects to the server and 2 workstations. Why would the sales workstations just feed into the server? I actually had this exact PBQ back in July '21.

discussion.content: this PBQ was in the exam i took...
Simulation it's correct. "Layer 3 Switch it's really (also) a router" (Pr.Messer). You MUST connect any VLANs to the switch, right?

discussion.content: question no longer looks like this good luck

I disagree. POP (110) and IMAP (143) are used in receiving and retrieving emails, respectively. The question clearly asks which port is to be left open so the server can relay/send emails. This is clearly the function of SMTP (25).

https://www.siteground.com/tutorials/email/protocols-pop3-smtp-imap/
This one is simple. Shouldn't even be debated

comments.content: Some people maybe make mistake on it so dont act or make other feel like they are weak when they answered wrong
More you look into Comptia questions more you will start doubting the "simple" questions!

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Port 25 for relaying emails

Selected Answer: B
Port 25 is the default port for relaying email on the internet. However, you can specify any port number (Provided it is within the acceptable range of custom port numbers) for submitting emails to your SMTP server. There are special cases when you must use port 25 on your SMTP server.
key words here are "relay email". Port 25 is the answer.

SMTP can be used to both send and receive mail. Post Office Protocol version
3 (POP3) and Internet Message Access Protocol version 4 (IMAP4) can be
used only to receive mail.

Step #1: After composing a message and hitting send, your email client - whether it's Outlook Express or Gmail - connects to your domain's SMTP server. This server can be named many things; a standard example would be smtp.example.com.

Step #2: Your email client communicates with the SMTP server, giving it your email address, the recipient's email address, the message body and any attachments.

So answer is port 25 which is B

comments.content: Kinda gives you a hint, you get 3 email protocols, 2 are used to receive, 1 isn't and there's only an option for one answer. While you should know the material blah blah blah using every which way you can to eliminate other answers is important.

discussion.content: This one kinda throws you off as it says default ports. And it doesn't tell you to select 1 or multiple answers

questions.question_text: A junior network technician is setting up a new email server on the company network. Which of the following default ports should the technician ensure is open on the firewall so the new email server can relay email?

discussion.content: The answers stated are correct. The antenna type is clearly wrong as they are different readings in different directions meaning they are not omnidirectional :)
how could this be incorrect antenna type? Surely this is an issue with interference??

he places it in the middle. Now on the objectives there are two options omnidirectional or unidirectional antenna. Since it is not evenly distributed we would assume it to be unidirectional. But even if it was omnidirectional there could be interference on both sides or no interference on one side.
